thread.title: Adele stops during emotional George Michael Grammys tribute: 'I can't mess this up for him'
thread.title_full: Adele stops during emotional George Michael Grammys tribute: 'I can't mess this up for him'

author: Our Foreign Staff
title: Adele stops during emotional George Michael Grammys tribute: 'I can't mess this up for him'
text:
Adele stops during emotional George Michael Grammys tribute: 'I can't mess this up for him' Adele performing a tribute to late George Michael at the Grammys Credit: Getty Images Our Foreign Staff 13 February 2017 • 4:36am 
A dele, who had trouble with her live performance at last year's Grammys, restarted her tribute to George Michael on Sunday at this year's awards, telling the audience: "I can't mess this up for him." 
Adele wanted her performance of Fastlove during the George Michael tribute at Sunday's Grammy Awards to be perfect. So when it wasn't, she cursed, then started over on live TV. #Adele taught us a all a great lesson just now. If it's not right? START OVER AND NAIL IT! And she did. Love you, girl. — Bette Midler (@BetteMidler) 13 February 2017 
"I'm sorry. I can't mess this up for him," she said to the audience. "Can we start again?" 
T he second performance was flawless and heartfelt, as images of the late singer, who died unexpectedly on Christmas Day at age 53 , played on the screen behind her. Adele performs George Michael's Festlove at the Grammys Credit: Getty Images 
T he British superstar looked near tears as she finished, as the crowd received the performance with a standing ovation at the Staples Center in Los Angeles. — Recording Academy (@RecordingAcad) 13 February 2017 
T he 28-year-old kicked off the awards with a live and perfect rendition of her comeback anthem, Hello, which won song of the year over Beyonce. The two superstars are going head-to-head in two more top categories. 
Adele also won two early Grammys: Hello won best pop solo performance and 2" won pop vocal album in the pre-telecast ceremony. When asked to pay tribute to George Michael, @Adele personally picked Michael’s 1996 single “Fastlove.” #GRAMMYs — Recording Academy (@RecordingAcad) 13 February 2017 
A t last year's show, the British singer had a hiccup after a microphone inside a piano fell onto the instrument's strings during her performance of All I Ask. Beyonce killed me Adele gave me life I'm confused
